custom_item_1.info: Bluetooth allows devices to connect wirelessly to headsets, car kits, and other accessories for various Bluetooth profile functionality. It is recommended that Bluetooth be disabled when not in use.
custom_item_1.solution: From the AirWatch console, open the Android device profile. Under Restrictions verify that Allow Bluetooth is not checked.

custom_item_2.description: 1.1.9 - AirWatch - Disable 'Location Services' - GPS Location Services
custom_item_2.info: Location Services allows applications such as Maps and Internet websites to gather and use data indicating the user's location. The user's approximate location is determined using available information from cellular network data, local Wi-Fi networks (if the user has Wi-Fi turned on), and GPS as available. If the user turns off Location Services, the user will be prompted to turn it back on again the next time an application tries to use this feature. It is recommended that location services be disabled when not required.
custom_item_2.solution: From the AirWatch console, open the Android device profile. Under Restrictions verify that Allow GPS Location Services is not checked.

custom_item_3.description: 1.1.9 - AirWatch - Disable 'Location Services' - WiFi Location Services
custom_item_3.info: Location Services allows applications such as Maps and Internet websites to gather and use data indicating the user's location. The user's approximate location is determined using available information from cellular network data, local Wi-Fi networks (if the user has Wi-Fi turned on), and GPS as available. If the user turns off Location Services, the user will be prompted to turn it back on again the next time an application tries to use this feature. It is recommended that location services be disabled when not required.
custom_item_3.solution: From the AirWatch console, open the Android device profile. Under Restrictions verify that Allow Wireless Network Location Services is not checked.

custom_item_4.info: This control determines whether notifications are displayed on screen when the device is locked. The recommended setting is disabled.
custom_item_4.solution: From the AirWatch console, open the Android device profile. Under Restrictions verify that Allow Notifications is not checked.

custom_item_6.info: This control determines whether JavaScript programming code is allowed run in the browser. The recommended setting is disabled.
custom_item_6.solution:
From the AirWatch console, open the Android device profile. Under Restrictions verify that Enable JavaScript is not checked.
NOTE: This option will not appear if Allow Native Android Browser is not enabled.

custom_item_7.info: This control determines whether the device browser will accept and store HTTP cookies sent by websites the user accesses. The recommended setting is disabled.
custom_item_7.solution:
From the AirWatch console, open the Android device profile. Under Restrictions verify that Allow Cookies is not checked.
NOTE: This option will not appear if Allow Native Android Browser is not enabled.

custom_item_8.info: This control determines if new passwords are required to satisfy a certain level of complexity. The recommended settings are enable alpha-numeric device password.
custom_item_8.solution: From the AirWatch console, open the Android device profile. Under Passcode verify that Passcode Content is set to alphanumeric.

custom_item_10.description: 2.1.4 - AirWatch - Set the 'minimum number of character sets' - 'Lower Case'
custom_item_10.info: This control determines if new passwords are required to satisfy a certain level of complexity. The recommended setting is the minimum device password complexity is set to 1 or more characters.
custom_item_10.solution:
From the AirWatch console, open the Android device profile. Under Passcode verify that Minimum Number of Lower Case Letters is set to 1 or more.
NOTE: This setting is only available if the passcode content setting is Complex.

custom_item_11.description: 2.1.4 - AirWatch - Set the 'minimum number of character sets' - 'Upper Case'
custom_item_11.info: This control determines if new passwords are required to satisfy a certain level of complexity. The recommended setting is the minimum device password complexity is set to 1 or more characters.
custom_item_11.solution:
From the AirWatch console, open the Android device profile. Under Passcode verify that Minimum Number of Upper Case Letters is set to 1 or more.
NOTE: This setting is only available if the passcode content setting is Complex.

custom_item_12.description: 2.1.4 - AirWatch - Set the 'minimum number of character sets' - 'Symbols'
custom_item_12.info: This control determines if new passwords are required to satisfy a certain level of complexity. The recommended setting is the minimum device password complexity is set to 1 or more characters.
custom_item_12.solution:
From the AirWatch console, open the Android device profile. Under Passcode verify that Minimum Number of Symbols is set to 1 or more.
NOTE: This setting is only available if the passcode content setting is Complex.

custom_item_13.description: 2.1.4 - AirWatch - Set the 'minimum number of character sets' - 'Numbers'
custom_item_13.info: This control determines if new passwords are required to satisfy a certain level of complexity. The recommended setting is the minimum device password complexity is set to 1 or more characters.
custom_item_13.solution:
From the AirWatch console, open the Android device profile. Under Passcode verify that Minimum Number of Numerical Digits is set to 1 or more.
NOTE: This setting is only available if the passcode content setting is Complex.

custom_item_14.description: 2.1.7 - AirWatch - Set the 'number of days' for 'maximum password age'
custom_item_14.info: This control defined how many days a user can use the same password before it expires. The recommended state for this setting is 90 days or less.
custom_item_14.solution: From the AirWatch console, open the Android device profile. Under Passcode verify that Maximum Passcode Age (days) is set to 90 or less.

custom_item_15.description: 2.1.8 - AirWatch - Set the 'number of passwords' for 'password history'
custom_item_15.info: This control defines the number of unique passwords a user must leverage before a previously used password can be reused. The recommended state for this setting is 24 or more passwords remembered.
custom_item_15.solution: From the AirWatch console, open the Android device profile. Under Passcode verify that Passcode History is set to 24 or more.
